# Introduction

This document demonstrates a typical data analysis workflow using Quarto and Python.

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Create sample data
np.random.seed(42)
data = {
    'name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie', 'Diana', 'Eve'],
    'age': [25, 30, 35, 28, 32],
    'salary': [50000, 60000, 75000, 55000, 70000],
    'department': ['Engineering', 'Marketing', 'Engineering', 'Sales', 'Marketing']
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)
```

## Data Overview

Let's examine the structure and summary statistics of our dataset.

```{python}
#| label: data-overview
#| echo: true
print("Dataset Shape:", df.shape)
print("\nColumn Types:")
print(df.dtypes)
```

```{python}
#| label: summary-stats
df.describe()
```

## Analysis by Department

Group the data by department and calculate mean values.

```{python}
#| label: department-analysis
#| fig-cap: "Department statistics"
department_stats = df.groupby('department').agg({
    'age': 'mean',
    'salary': ['mean', 'min', 'max']
})
print(department_stats)
```

## Visualization

```{python}
#| label: fig-scatter
#| fig-cap: "Age vs Salary scatter plot"
#| fig-width: 8
#| fig-height: 6
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 6))
plt.scatter(df['age'], df['salary'])
plt.xlabel('Age')
plt.ylabel('Salary')
plt.title('Age vs Salary')
plt.show()
```

## Conclusion

This analysis shows the distribution of employees across departments.
